thread.title: Community Leadership Skill-Building Workshop to Be Held at Stockton’s Manahawkin Instructional Site
thread.title_full: Community Leadership Skill-Building Workshop to Be Held at Stockton’s Manahawkin Instructional Site

author: (Staff)
title: Community Leadership Skill-Building Workshop to Be Held at Stockton’s Manahawkin Instructional Site
text:
Community Leadership Skill-Building Workshop to Be Held at Stockton’s Manahawkin Instructional Site Oct 14, 2015 
A day-long Community Leadership Skill-Building Workshop on identifying and organizing community initiatives will take place at Stockton University’s Manahawkin Instructional Site, located at 712 East Bay Ave., on Tuesday, Oct. 27, from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. 
“A community initiative can be anything from developing and implementing a fundraising walk to getting policy changed through town council,” said Erin O’Hanlon, program assistant in Stockton’s Office of Service-Learning, who will lead the workshop. “This course trains participants in mobilizing communities around the issues that matter most to them.” 
The program is free and open to students, faculty, staff and community members and partners. 
Registration is required. To sign up, call 609-626-3883. 
For more information on other activities and classes at the Manahawkin Instructional Site, visit stockton.edu/manahawkin . —K.A.E.
